page.title: 11NORTH FORELAND RADIO STATION
page.content: {North Foreland Radio}is a busy coastal radio station handling about 500 calls daily from all shipping entering the English Channel.Its area covers from Lowestoft to the Greenwich Buoy(the mark of the Meridian in the Channel) and out to Flushing Roads.Both Thames and Hastings radio are controlled here.It is manned by 15 staff working in shifts but this will be cut to 7 1n 1987 when the station becomes semi- automatic.{British Telecom}are laying a third shallow water submarine telephone link between Broadstairs and Ostend in 1985.This new experimental cable uses optical fibre cable to transmit conversations and data and is the first in the world.The land links were installed Spring 1985.{Ramsgate {Post Office}is to be rebuilt in 1985 and by October will have the newest up to date counter in E.Kent.
